title: Why is Durga Maa’s Idol made from the “soil of a prostitute”? - Quora

response.answer_text: Durga idol requires many different soils for its creation. Soil from Ganga, courtyard of a king, soil from Shakti peetha, soil from an anthill, soil from the tusk of a boar, soil from a cremation ground along with soil from the yard of vesya i.e. a prostitute is required. Durga puja is a tantric festival that celebrates Shakti and tantra texts advice us to view every women as a manifestation of the goddess. Vidyah samasta devibhedah striyah samastah sakala jagatsu. Tvayekaya puritamambayetat kate stuti stavyaparaparokti. Every women must thus be honoured. There is also a belief that when a man visits a prostitute he leaves behind all his punya (good deeds) at her doorstep. The soil of the doorstep is thus called punya mati. Many families carry out Durga puja without a clay idol in such cases these soils are spread below the Devi ghat.
She killed the lusty Mahishasur. Prostitutes(Veshya) were sacred in ancient india. They remove the lust from society. So it is symbolic representation .
